snippet.title: Will.i.am Could Soon Be In Charge Of Your Smart Home
snippet.content:
Image: Marvel
Will.i.am has had a breaking into the tech market. In his latest entrepreneurial venture, he's jumping into the smart home game. What could go wrong?
Will.i.am has a chequered history of making pieces of consumer technology that nobody really wants. Now you can add to that list a pair of Bluetooth headphones.
Innovator and musician Will.i.am's lack of luck in the gadget world has always come down to the fact that he's been so far ahead of his time. It's not that his failed ideas' time has ever come, but it will one day. While people like Musk and Zuckerberg over how much of a threat is posed by the AI revolution, Will.i.am has been warning us that we need to before we 3D-print humans. Were you thinking about that? No. He was, long before you.
Among Will.i.am's gadgets that haven't taken off, he's released: a that had its own app called i.am+foto.sosho, a smart watch that was that was actually two smart cuffs that you wear at the same time, and, most recently, some that make you look like your wearing two of Lieutenant Uhura's at the same time. In 2016, he another smart watch that required you to pay $US28 ($35) a month for some sort of service and it had no apps. "The last paradigm was the apps thing," he said at the time. And he was right. And it still is.
That shit's in the past and Will is all about the future.
